Package camzup.core

Class Curve2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.EntityData
camzup.core.Curve
camzup.core.Curve2
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICurve, IEntityData, ISvgWritable, IUtils, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Knot2>
public class Curve2
extends Curve
implements java.lang.Iterable<Knot2>, ISvgWritable
Organizes a 2D Bezier curve into a list of knots. Provides a function to retrieve a point and tangent on a curve from a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] .

The primitives available from this class are partially informed by the scalable vector graphics (SVG) specification.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Curve2.Easing
    An easing function to facilitate animation between multiple curves.

    static Curve2 infinity​(Curve2 target)
    Creates a curve that approximates Bernoulli's lemniscate, which resembles an infinity loop (with equally proportioned lobes).

    The curve is set as a closed loop; however, it intersects itself, and so may lead to rendering issues when used with a fill.

    Transforms all knots in the curve by a matrix.
    Curve2 transform​(Transform2 tr)
    Transforms all coordinates in the curve permanently by a transform.

    Not to be confused with the temporary transformations applied by a curve entity's transform to the meshes contained within the entity.

    Useful when consolidating multiple curve entities into one curve entity.

    Translates all knots in the curve by a vector.

      public Curve2 reverse()

      Returns:
      this curve

    • ellipse

      public static Curve2 ellipse​(float aspect, Curve2 target)
      Creates a curve which approximates an ellipse; currently there is support only for 4 knot ellipses. The aspect ratio is that between the ellipse's major and minor axes.
      Parameters:
      aspect - the aspect
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the ellipse

    • eval

      public static Knot2 eval​(Curve2 curve, float step, Knot2 target)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0], returning a knot on the curve. The knot's fore handle and rear handle are mirrored.
      Parameters:
      curve - the curve
      step - the step
      target - the output knot
      Returns:
      the knot

    • eval

      public static Ray2 eval​(Curve2 curve, float step, Ray2 ray)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0], returning a ray. The ray's origin will be a coordinate on the curve while its direction will be a normalized tangent.
      Parameters:
      curve - the curve
      step - the step
      ray - the output ray
      Returns:
      the ray
      See Also:
      eval(Curve2, float, Vec2, Vec2)

    • eval

      public static Vec2 eval​(Curve2 curve, float step, Vec2 coord, Vec2 tangent)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0], returning a coordinate on the curve and a tangent. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      curve - the curve
      step - the step
      coord - the output coordinate
      tangent - the output tangent
      Returns:
      the coordinate
      See Also:
      Vec2.bezierPoint(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, float, Vec2), Vec2.bezierTanUnit(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, float, Vec2)

      curve - the curve
      handedness - the handedness
      target - the output transform
      Returns:
      the coordinate
      See Also:
      Curve3.evalFirst(Curve3, Vec3, Vec3)

    • fromPoints

      public static Curve2 fromPoints​(boolean closedLoop, Vec2[] points, Curve2 target)
      Creates a curve from a series of points. Smoothes the fore- and rear-handles of each knot.
      Parameters:
      closedLoop - whether the curve is a closed loop
      points - the array of points
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the curve

    • infinity

      public static Curve2 infinity​(Curve2 target)
      Creates a curve that approximates Bernoulli's lemniscate, which resembles an infinity loop (with equally proportioned lobes).

      The curve is set as a closed loop; however, it intersects itself, and so may lead to rendering issues when used with a fill.
      Parameters:
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the lemniscate

    • line

      public static Curve2 line​(Vec2 origin, Vec2 dest, Curve2 target)
      Creates a curve that forms a line with an origin and destination.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the line

      Creates a regular convex polygon.

      offsetAngle - the offset angle
      radius - the radius
      knotCount - the number of knots
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the polygon

    • random

      public static Curve2 random​(java.util.Random rng, int count, float lowerBound, float upperBound, boolean closedLoop, Curve2 target)
      Creates a random curve. Generates random points, creates a curve from those points, then smoothes the knots' handles.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      count - the number of knots to generate
      lowerBound - the lower bound
      upperBound - the upper bound
      closedLoop - whether the curve is a closed loop
      target - the target curve
      Returns:
      the random curve

    • random

      public static Curve2 random​(java.util.Random rng, int count, Vec2 lowerBound, Vec2 upperBound, boolean closedLoop, Curve2 target)
      Creates a random curve. Generates random points, creates a curve from those points, then smoothes the knots' handles.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      count - the number of knots to generate
      lowerBound - the lower bound
      upperBound - the upper bound
      closedLoop - whether the curve is a closed loop
      target - the target curve

      the random curve

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(float lbx, float lby, float ubx, float uby, float corner, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rounded rectangle. The fifth parameter specifies the corner rounding factor.
      Parameters:
      lbx - lower bound x
      lby - lower bound y
      ubx - upper bound x
      uby - upper bound y
      corner - the rounding factor
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rounded rectangle

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(float lbx, float lby, float ubx, float uby, float tl, float tr, float br, float bl, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rounded rectangle. The first four parameters specify the lower and upper bound of the rectangle. The next four parameters specify the rounding factor for the top left, top right, bottom right and bottom left corners.
      Parameters:
      lbx - lower bound x
      lby - lower bound y
      ubx - upper bound x
      uby - upper bound y
      tl - rounding top left corner
      tr - rounding top right corner
      br - rounding bottom right corner
      bl - rounding bottom left corner
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rounded rectangle

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(Vec2 tl, Vec2 br, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rectangle. The first coordinate specifies the top left corner; the second coordinate specifies the bottom right corner.
      Parameters:
      tl - the top left corner
      br - the bottom right corner
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rectangle

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(Vec2 tl, Vec2 br, float corner, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rounded rectangle. The first coordinate specifies the top left corner; the second coordinate specifies the bottom right corner. The third parameter specifies the corner rounding factor.
      Parameters:
      tl - the top left corner
      br - the bottom right corner
      corner - the rounding factor
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rounded rectangle

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(Vec2 tl, Vec2 br, float tlCorner, float trCorner, float brCorner, float blCorner, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rounded rectangle. The first coordinate specifies the top left corner; the second coordinate, specifies the bottom right corner. The next four parameters specify the rounding factor for the top left, top right, bottom right and bottom left corners.
      Parameters:
      tl - the top left corner
      br - the bottom right corner
      tlCorner - rounding top left corner
      trCorner - rounding top right corner
      brCorner - rounding bottom right corner
      blCorner - rounding bottom left corner
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rounded rectangle

    • smoothHandles

      public static Curve2 smoothHandles​(Curve2 target)
      Adjusts knot handles so as to create a smooth, continuous curve.
      Parameters:
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the curve
      See Also:
      Knot2.smoothHandles(Knot2, Knot2, Knot2, Vec2), Knot2.smoothHandlesLast(Knot2, Knot2, Vec2), Knot2.smoothHandlesFirst(Knot2, Knot2, Vec2)

    • straightenHandles

      public static Curve2 straightenHandles​(Curve2 target)
      Adjusts knot handles so as to create straight line segments.
      Parameters:
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the curve
      See Also:
      lerp13(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2), Knot2.mirrorHandlesBackward(), Knot2.mirrorHandlesForward()
